website_summaries.verdict: Robust for its small size, this solar-optional generator charges rapidly and powers small devices for hours.
pros: Solar charging is relatively fast, bringing battery to full charge in about 8 hours
Includes MC4 connector for solar panels
Great battery life, especially for charging smartphones and other small devices
cons: Solar connector may make a buzzing noise if solar panel is not in direct sunlight
As with almost all solar-capable generators, panels are sold separately
MC4 connector’s cable is pretty short

customer_reviews.title: Who is laughing now?
customer_reviews.text: When I old my husband that I am buying this for our camping trips he was laughing at me and saying how "we don't need it". This little generator is so powerful and versatile We are not only using it when camping but we use it at home, while sitting on the deck. Charging our outdoor speaker, using to power our umbrella lights, charging our phone while sitting by the fire and don't have outlet handy. I love to have it on our road trips so I can charge my Cannon camera batteries, as well. My husband now loves this thing and admits that he was wrong and I was right. As usual. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ornela Beslagic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an astronomy rig
customer_reviews.text: This battery is just exactly what I needed to run an astronomy rig. It has a smaller footprint than the traditional power tank and fits easily on the accessory platform on my old Celestron Wedgepod. No more tripping on wiring harnesses for me! What's more, the Amp-hour rating on this little Lithium cell is vastly greater than any of the other power tanks I've used. I could actively run a Go-to scope all night on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon YorkTop Contributor: Astronomy

customer_reviews.title: This is not solar powered & failed during the first emergency use.
customer_reviews.text: Well I'm disappointed to say the least... When I first received it a couple of years ago, I purchased it because it was a solar, portable generator. You have to buy a solar panel to go with it. I tested it once, successfully to see that it would turn on and power things as expected. But when I really needed it, last month, it would not turn on. I left it charging for about 24 hours, and there was still no power. It was not there when I needed it most...
customer_reviews.author: CLAIRE HUTCHINSON

customer_reviews.title: Great compact size, works well
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once - needed it to run computer/ cricut etc at a scrapbook expo - worked great. Still not sure how many hours of use I would get from it. I think its great to have as back up for power failures etc, great for travel. Very small and so much easier to carry around than the black & Decker charger I used to use. A little pricey but worth it for the small size. Would love to know about the solar attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Denise B

customer_reviews.title: Fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like it. It is very light and has a good variety of features but has a fatal flaw. No overcharge protection. Another reviewer pointed that out and I ignored it. Had it 18 months and usually I would unplug the AC charger ASAP when the unit hit full charge. As was sure to happen sooner or later I left it on the charger one time overnight and it was toast. At this price point no overcharge protection is inexcusable. Save your money and look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power - easy to transport!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to power a CPAP unit for a camping trip - it ran the unit for 6+ hours each night for three nights, and charged a cell phone from dead to full on top of it. Note, it was a travel CPAP, so no humidifier, and we powered directly from the DC side, so nothing lost in conversion. But these things hold a LOT of juice, in a very light and portable package. Built-in light was useful, too!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Enough for an over night in a small cabin - a few lights and recharge your cell
customer_reviews.text: This product is fine. It's super portable and convenient. I use it in a small cabin and can power 4-5 15 watt CFL bulbs for maybe 5 hours and keep my cell phone charged. I keep thinking it would be a lot better if I switch to DC or LED bulbs which this unit could handle just fine. But I'm lazy that way.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Changed Camping
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful and I can't imagine camping without it. Now I can bring my blow up mattress to put in the tent and we can charge our phones for days. Definitely spoils you.

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and working well
customer_reviews.text: Received a communication today with the download link for the missing User Manual, the seller's reply to my inquiry was very timely and courteous. Really like the small size of the product, will be easily transportable to whatever location I choose to take it and the layout of the plugs. Everything is easy to see and in one place. The unit came fully charged, but plugged in for about an hour and the reading was saying full charge. Have had a large floor fan plugged into the unit now for 3 hours continuously and the battery is still running strong showing about a 2/3 charge so very pleased with the battery's performance so far.

customer_reviews.title: Had an issue but their support team made it right!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for Christmas 2017. Checked it out but didn't really have a use for it at the time. Now, when I need it I find that it doesn't appear to charge and it won't turn on unless it is connected to the AC charger. Left it to charge for an entire day and nothing. I contacted Coolis support and after a few emails back and forth, they made it right by arranging for me to get a replacement unit. Kudos to them for understanding my dilemma and working to make it right. Their support is top notch! I can't wait to see how well this unit works once I get the new one.
customer_reviews.author: R James

EASY RECHARGABLE by SUN,WALL SOCKET and CAR: (1)By 18V under 100W compatible solar panel, For Solar panel ,you can refer to the following description details of suggestion. （2)By wall charger(included). 3)By 12V car charger(included). Please note: It's take ~7 hours for full charge by wall charger, but maybe take 3 days by solar panel.

LED SCREEN PROTECTION FILM and BMS: LED screen is covered with a film for protection,It's normal if any scratchs on the protection film (please remove it before using).
